reviews.text: We picked this hotel from a website and were most impressed. We stayed 3 nights and had a room on the top floor, in the corner. We didnt hear any traffic noise and slept well in the huge bed. The only TV we could understand was CNN and we were able to follow the terrible events happening in New Orleans with the hurricane. The staff were very helpful however their English was limited, as was our Japanese. Breakfast was included in the tarrif, and was ok. The location is good, and i felt quite safe walking around the area on my own. Bathrobes supplied and a high tech toilet!
reviews.title: great hotel, would stay again

reviews.title: the b roppongi, the new hip hotel

reviews.text: Based on reviews from this website, we stayed at the B Roppongi for two nights in Mid-April followed by two nights at the Park Hotel (2005 Traveller's Choice). If I went back to Tokyo again I would stay at the B Roppongi. The only real difference between the rooms in both hotels in my opinion was the view (which is magnificent in the Park Hotel), the heated toilet seat and the lack of an in-room safe. But in all honesty I would rather pay the much cheaper room rate for the B Roppongi and spend the extra money on a meal or entertainment.
reviews.title: Hard To Beat
Definitely a Great Choice
reviews.text: The "B" was easy to find, in fact the bus from Narita airport took us right past it. We had standard non-smoking double room at the B which was great - very clean, no problem with noise and of a perfectly acceptable size - as large if not larger than our room at the Park Hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful, although did not speak as good English as the staff at the Park Hotel. The breakfast, which was unexpectedly included, was basic but good. There are even beer dispensing machines on each floor (Y250 a can) !! The rooms are hooked up for internet access for those who need it. Robe & slippers. Nice LCD TV but no english channels.

If I had to summarise, I thought the B Roppongi was an excellent hotel which didn't try and do or provide everything, but did the basics perfectly. Personally, I would rather stay in a hotel that concentrates doing what it does well than somewhere that tries to be everything and fails. Value-for-money I think the B Roppongi is hard to beat. We payed circa Aus$180 per night ($135 US).
reviews.title: Fab hotel in a Fab City

reviews.text: Location wise the B was excellent: 40 min walk to Shibuya or Harajuku. 3 min walk to Roppongi tube, and to Roppongi Hills and the Mori tower (Tokyo City View). Lots of local bars with happy hour (the only time we could afford to drink) and some great local restaurants - you have to check out Gonpachi (which is apparantly where Tarantino got his scene for Kill Bill).
